Diffusion Models¶

The stochastic.diffusion module provides classes for generating (discretely sampled) continous diffusion processes using the Euler–Maruyama method.

  • stochastic.diffusion.ConstantElasticityVarianceProcess
  • stochastic.diffusion.CoxIngersollRossProcess
  • stochastic.diffusion.OrnsteinUhlenbeckProcess
  • stochastic.diffusion.VasicekProcess
class stochastic.diffusion.ConstantElasticityVarianceProcess(t=1, mu=1, sigma=1, gamma=1)[source]¶

Constant elasticity of variance process.

sample(n, start, zero=True)¶

Generate a realization of a Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process.

t¶

Time end.

times(n, zero=True)¶

Generate times associated with n increments on [0, t].

Parameters:
  • n (int) – the number of increments
  • zero (bool) – if True, include \(t=0\)
class stochastic.diffusion.CoxIngersollRossProcess(t=1, speed=1, mean=1, vol=1)[source]¶
